content: Judge temporarily stops funeral protest law KANSAS CITY, Mo. — The Kansas City suburb of Gladstone temporarily has been barred from enforcing a funeral protest ordinance. The Kansas City Star is reporting on its Web site that a Kansas City federal judge issued the ruling Tuesday. Shirley L. Phelps-Roper of the Westboro Baptist Church requested the order pending a ruling on the constitutionality of the city’s ordinance that prohibits protests at soldiers’ funerals. >http://www.armytimes.com/news/2009/04/ap_funeral_protests_041509/ Here we go again.

title: Judge temporarily stops funeral protest law

content: I can't beleive they are both still licensed to practice law. I thought they'd be disbarred by now.

title: Judge temporarily stops funeral protest law

content: Fred Phelps has been disbarred in Kansas since 1979 Permanently. He also agreed to stop practicing law in Federal Courts in 1989. His Kids, including Marge suspended 6 months, Fred Jr.as well. For an Interesting read of Phelps extortion efforts: XXXhttp://www.splcenter.org/intel/intelreport/article.jsp?sid=184XXX My Personal Belief is that NO Funeral(Military or Civilian) should have Protestors. It dishonors the dead, and more importantly is highly intrusive to the families in their time of bereavement.
